intro: Terminalia eddowesii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Terminalia eddowesii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
